com.yantra.api.ycp.participant

Interface updateCustomerAccountBalance

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface updateCustomerAccountBalance

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document updateCustomerAccountBalance(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The updateCustomerAccountBalance() API can be called to update open order amount for a customer account.

    • Method Detail

      • updateCustomerAccountBalance

        org.w3c.dom.Document updateCustomerAccountBalance(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                  org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                                  java.rmi.RemoteException
        The updateCustomerAccountBalance() API can be called to update open order amount for a customer account. When settlement happens within application for a customer account order, open order amount against the customer account is reduced automatically. If settlement happens outside the application then external systems should call this API to reduce the open order amount.

        Note: This API should be called only for customer accounts that maintain limits and authorization within the system.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:None.

        Events Raised:

          CUSTOMER_DEFINITION.ON_ACCOUNT_BALANCE_CHANGE: This event is raised when open order amount is changed by external systems.
          ON_ACCOUNT_BALANCE_CHANGE
            Data published - YCP_CUSTOMER_DEFINITION.ON_ACCOUNT_BALANCE_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - Key Data
            Template Support - Yes

    Audits: None

    Pre-conditions: None

    Post-conditions: None

    Output Template Support: Yes

    Database Extensibility Support: Yes

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException
java.rmi.RemoteException
